alert.note: Alert for Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:57AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cape May County through 1115 AM EDT... At 1056 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Diamond Beach, or over Cape May, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cape May, North Wildwood, Wildwood Crest, West Cape May, Stone Harbor, Diamond Beach, Rio Grande, West Wildwood, Erma and Whitesboro-Burleigh. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Little to no cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm, but may develop at any time. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May
